tn.ref: the land must be made to keep a Sabbath for Yahweh
tn.text: The land is spoken of as if it were a person that could obey the Sabbath by resting. Just as the people had to rest every seventh day, people were to honor God by not farming the land every seventh year. AT: "you must obey the Sabbath law by letting the land rest every seventh year for Yahweh" or "you must obey Yahweh's Sabbath by not farming the land every seventh year" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
To prune a vineyard is to cut the branches and vines to help the fruit grow better.

tn.ref: a Sabbath of solemn rest for the land must be observed
tn.text: Not farming the land is spoken of as letting the land rest. This can be stated in active form. AT: "you must observe a Sabbath of solemn rest for the land" or "you must obey the Sabbath law by not farming the land every seventh year"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: You must not conduct ... who live with you may gather food
tn.text: In 25:5-6 Yahweh means he will not allow the owner of a field to organize his workers and harvest the land as he does the other six years. However, Yahweh will allow individuals to go through the fields to pick and eat the fruit they find.

This means that no one has taken care of the vines and cut them as they do during the other six years. This can be stated in active form. AT: "your vines that you do not prune" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"whatever grows on the unworked land"

This means that no one has taken care of the gardens or farms as they do during the other six years. This can be stated in active form. AT: "your gardens that you do not tend" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"whatever grows on the land"
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do.

tn.ref: there will be seven Sabbaths of years
tn.text: "they will be seven sets of seven years"
nine years** - "49 years" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: the tenth day of the seventh month
tn.text: This is the seventh month of the Hebrew calendar. The tenth day is near the end of September on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

On this day each year the high priest would make a sacrifice to Yahweh so that Yahweh would forgive all the sins of the people of Israel. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:23:26|23:27]].
This is an ordinal number. AT: "year 50" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
The Jubilee was a year when the Jews had to return land to its' original owners and set slaves free. AT: "a year of restoration for you" or "a year for you to return land and free slaves"

tn.ref: property and slaves must be returned
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you must return property and slaves" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

"a year of restoration" or "a year for you to return the land." It can be stated clearly who they were returning the land to. AT: "a year for you to return the land to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: You must eat the produce that grows by itself out of the fields
tn.text: Yahweh did not allow the land owner to organize his workers and harvest the land as he did the other six years. However, he did allow individuals to go through the fields and eat what they find.
"this year of restoration" or "this year to return land and free slaves"
God continues telling Moses what the people must do.
This can be stated in active form. AT: "that you can harvest" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"the next year of restoration" or "the next year to return land"

tn.ref: obey my decrees, keep my laws, and carry them out
tn.text: All of these phrases mean basically the same thing. They emphasize that the people must obey everything Yahweh says. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
This means that they would eat enough until their stomach was full. AT: "you will eat till you are full" or "you will eat plenty" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Here "You" refers to the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: I will command my blessing to come upon you
tn.text: God speaks of his blessing as if it were a person that could obey him. AT: "I will send my blessing on you" or "I will bless you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "from the food you store" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Yahweh continues speaking.

tn.ref: The land must not be sold to a new permanent owner
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "You must not sell your land permanently to another person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: You must observe the right of redemption
tn.text: The noun "redemption" can be expressed with the verbs "redeem" or "buy back." AT: "You must remember that the original owner has the right to redeem the land whenever he wants" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: you must allow the land to be bought back by the family from whom you bought it
tn.text: This can be stated in active form.  AT: "you must allow the family from whom you bought the land to buy it back" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "he sold the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: repay the balance to the man to whom he sold it
tn.text: This can be made explicit. AT: "repay to the purchaser who bought it the money the purchaser would have made" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"the year of restoration" or "the year to return land." See how you translated it in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:25:10|25:10]].
This can be stated in active form. AT: "the one who had bought it will return the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"will go back to his land"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "after he sold it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The noun "redemption" can be expressed with the verbs "redeem" or "buy back." AT: "the right to redeem it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: If the house is not redeemed
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "If he or his family does not redeem the house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: That house is not to be returned
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The man who bought that house will not have to return it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"the year of restoration" or "the year to return land and free slaves"

tn.ref: But the houses of the villages that have no wall
tn.text: Some villages did not have a wall around them.

tn.ref: They may be redeemed, and they must be returned
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "You may buy back those houses, and those who bought them must return them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"the year of restoration" or "the year to return land and free slaves"

tn.ref: the houses owned by the Levites in their cities
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the houses that the Levites own in their cities" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: may be redeemed at any time
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the Levites may redeem them at any time" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the house that was sold in the city where it is located must be returned
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the one who bought the house in the city where it is located must return it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"the year of restoration" or "the year to return land and free slaves"

tn.ref: their property among the people of Israel
tn.text: The land of Canaan was divided up among the people of Israel, but of that land, the Levites were only given 48 cities with the fields around them. AT: "their part of the land that the Israelites possessed" or "their property in the land of Israel"

tn.ref: But the fields around their cities may not be sold
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "But the Levites must not sell the fields around their cities" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do.
"Do not make him pay you back more than what you lend him"

tn.ref: you must not make him work like a slave. Treat him as a hired servant
tn.text: This means the owner was to treat the Israelite with more respect than he would treat a slave.
"the year of restoration" or "the year to return land and free slaves"
God continues telling Moses what he must tell the people.
"your fellow countrymen are my servants"

tn.ref: They will not be sold as slaves
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "You must not sell them as slaves" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: you may buy slaves from them
tn.text: "you may buy slaves from those nations"

tn.ref: after your fellow Israelite has been bought, he may be bought back. Someone in his family may redeem him
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "after the foreigner buys your fellow Israelite, someone in the Israelite's family may buy him back" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
An Israelite could be a slave only until the year of Jubilee. These instructions are for when an Israelite wanted to buy back his freedom before the year of Jubilee.
"the year of restoration" or "the year to return land and to free slaves"

tn.ref: The price of his redemption must be figured
tn.text: The verb "figured" can be stated in active form. AT: "They must figure the price of his redemption"  or "They must figure how much to pay for the foreigner to set the Israelite free"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: in keeping with the rate paid to a hired servant
tn.text: If the Israelite bought back his freedom, the foreigner would have to hire a servant to do the work that the Israelite would have done but will not. The verbs "paid" and "hired" can be expressed in active form. AT: "according to the rate a person would pay to hire a servant"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: for the number of years he might continue to work
tn.text: "for the number of years until the jubilee that the Israelite would have continued to work but will not"
"the Israelite slave must pay back"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "The foreigner who bought him as a slave must treat him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: he is not treated with harshness
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "no one treats him badly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: If he is not redeemed by these means
tn.text: This can be stated in active form, and who he is to be redeemed from can be stated clearly. AT: "If no one redeems him by these means from the one who bought him as a slave" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"in this way"

tn.ref: he must serve until the year of Jubilee, he and his children with him
tn.text: The Israelite slave and his children would serve the foreigner until the year of Jubilee, and then the foreigner would have to set the Israelite and his children free.

tn.ref: To me the people of Israel are servants
tn.text: "For it is to me that the people of Israel are servants."  This is the reason that God wanted the Israelites to be set free in the year of jubilee. They were his servants. They were not permitted to be anyone else's permanent slave.
